popt4jlib.LocalSearch

Class IntSetN2RXPAllMovesMaker

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.LocalSearch.IntSetN2RXPAllMovesMaker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, AllChromosomeMakerClonableIntf, AllChromosomeMakerIntf
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IntSetN2RXPGraphAllMovesMaker

    public class IntSetN2RXPAllMovesMaker
extends java.lang.Object
implements AllChromosomeMakerClonableIntf
    the class implements the notion of the N_{-2+P} neighborhood of a set of integers. For a given set of integers S a set S' belongs to this neighborhood iff there are exactly two integers from S missing in S', and any number of other integers included in S' (as proposed by the possible combinations of integers computed by the associated IntSetNeighborhoodFilterIntf).

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • createAllChromosomes

        public java.util.Vector createAllChromosomes(java.lang.Object chromosome,
                                             java.util.HashMap params)
                                      throws OptimizerException
        implements the N_{-2+P} neighborhood for sets of integers.
        Specified by:
        createAllChromosomes in interface AllChromosomeMakerIntf
        Parameters:
        chromosome - Object // Set<Integer>
        params - HashMap must contain a key-value pair <"dls.intsetneighborhoodfilter",IntSetNeighborhoodFilterIntf filter>. The filter must both specify what two numbers to remove, as well as what ints to be tried for addition to the set given a vector of 2 ints to be removed from the set. In particular, the filter(Integer x, Set s, HashMap params) method must return a Vector<IntSet> that comprise all the 2-int combinations that may be tried for removal.
        Returns:
        Vector // Vector<IntSet>
        Throws:
        OptimizerException
